title: How to Make Light Hot Wings

steps.headline: Rinse the wings in cold water.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Place the wings on a cooking sheet and rub 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of pepper, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of Cajun seasoning and 3 oz of hot sauce on the wings.
Preheat the oven to 400ºF (200ºC).
steps.description: Handle the tray carefully when placing it in the oven.

steps.headline: Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
steps.description: Turn the chicken over and bake for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked thoroughly.

steps.headline: Mix hot sauce, ketchup, orange juice and brown sugar in a small bowl.
Make sure that all the lumps are mashed out from the brown sugar.
Dip the wings in the sauce until they are fully covered in sauce.

text:
Steps Rinse the wings in cold water. Cut the tips off with kitchen scissors or a knife. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5a\/Make-Light-Hot-Wings-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Light-Hot-Wings-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5a\/Make-Light-Hot-Wings-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-Light-Hot-Wings-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the wings on a cooking sheet and rub 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of pepper, 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of Cajun seasoning and 3 oz of hot sauce on the wings. Preheat the oven to 400ºF (200ºC). Handle the tray carefully when placing it in the oven. Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Turn the chicken over and bake for 10 minutes or until the chicken is cooked thoroughly. Preparing the sauce Mix hot sauce, ketchup, orange juice and brown sugar in a small bowl. Make sure that all the lumps are mashed out from the brown sugar. Dip the wings in the sauce until they are fully covered in sauce. Repeat and enjoy.
